sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.title: Use case cards: A use case reporting framework inspired by the european AI act
sciknow-25x1-scientific-papers.abstract:
Despite recent efforts by the Artificial Intelligence (AI) community to move towards standardised procedures for documenting models, methods, systems or datasets, there is currently no methodology focused on use cases aligned with the risk-based approach of the European AI Act (AI Act). In this paper, we propose a new framework for the documentation of use cases that we call use case cards , based on the use case modelling included in the Unified Markup Language (UML) standard. Unlike other documentation methodologies, we focus on the intended purpose and operational use of an AI system. It consists of two main parts: firstly, a UML-based template, tailored to allow implicitly assessing the risk level of the AI system and defining relevant requirements, and secondly, a supporting UML diagram designed to provide information about the system-user interactions and relationships. The proposed framework is the result of a co-design process involving a relevant team of EU policy experts and scientists. We have validated our proposal with 11 experts with different backgrounds and a reasonable knowledge of the AI Act as a prerequisite. We provide the 5 use case cards used in the co-design and validation process. Use case cards allows framing and contextualising use cases in an effective way, and we hope this methodology can be a useful tool for policy makers and providers for documenting use cases, assessing the risk level, adapting the different requirements and building a catalogue of existing usages of AI.

Keywords Trustworthy AI · AI policies · Transparency · Documentation · Use case modelling · Risk assessment

sciknow-25x1-research-contexts.fieldOfStudy: Artificial Intelligence, AI policies, Transparency, Documentation, Use case modelling, Risk assessment

guidingModels.relevance: Used as the foundation for the use case modelling included in the proposed use case cards framework.

sciknow-25x1-research-problems.problemStatement: There is currently no methodology focused on use cases aligned with the risk-based approach of the European AI Act (AI Act), which is necessary for documenting AI systems' intended purpose and operational use.
sciknow-25x1-research-problems.problemScope: The scope includes the development of a standardized framework for documenting AI use cases in accordance with the European AI Act's risk-based approach.
sciknow-25x1-research-problems.problemImportance: Addressing this problem is crucial for enabling policy makers and AI system providers to navigate the AI Act, assess AI systems' risk levels, and tailor requirements accordingly.
sciknow-25x1-research-problems.businessRelevance: Solving this problem has significant implications for AI system providers who need to comply with the European AI Act, and for policy makers who require standardized documentation to regulate AI systems effectively.

sciknow-25x1-research-questions.questionText: How can use cases be documented to align with the risk-based approach of the European AI Act?
What are the key information elements that need to be covered in a unique use case documentation methodology for AI systems?
How can the proposed use case cards framework be validated with experts from different backgrounds?

sciknow-25x1-future-directions.directionDescription: Involve a secondary phase of validation with AI system providers and users, to ensure use case cards are practical, clear and a useful tool for a diverse range of stakeholders.

Develop a web-based prototype of this registry integrating a machine-editable version of use case cards and allowing for the automated analysis of related statistics such as the number of use cases per application area, per product type, and most covered SDGs.

sciknow-25x1-potential-applications.applicationDescription: Use case cards as a standardized methodology for documenting AI use cases in the context of the European AI Act, particularly for policy makers and providers to assess the risk level of AI systems.
Smart camera system that shoots a picture only when all people posing are smiling, with potential misuse documentation such as monitoring workers' emotions.
Affective music recommender system proposing songs based on user's personality, mood, and playlist history, ensuring ethical use and not manipulating listener's emotions or behavior.
Driver attention monitoring system using in-cabin cameras to detect drowsiness and distraction, alerting the driver without taking full control of the vehicle.
AI system for student proctoring to detect cheating during exams by analyzing video for third persons, objects, impersonation, and suspicious behaviors.

sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.name: Use Case Cards Methodological Framework
sciknow-25x1-methodological-frameworks.description: The methodological framework involves the development of a structured approach for documenting AI use cases in alignment with the European AI Act's risk-based approach. The framework is based on the Unified Markup Language (UML) standard and tailored to assess the risk level of AI systems and define relevant requirements. It includes a UML-based template and a supporting UML diagram to provide information about system-user interactions and relationships. The framework was co-designed with EU policy experts and scientists and validated with experts from various backgrounds.

steps.description: Gather a team of EU policy experts, scientists, and a UML/UX expert.
steps.outputs: Initial design of the use case cards framework

steps.description: Develop a UML-based template and supporting UML diagram for documenting AI use cases.
steps.inputs: Requirements and risk assessment criteria from the European AI Act

steps.description: Iterate on the design based on feedback from stakeholders.

procedures.procedureDescription: A co-design process involving EU policy experts, scientists, and an external UML and UX expert to develop the use case cards framework.

steps.description: Select 11 experts with different backgrounds and knowledge of the AI Act.
Present the use case cards to the experts for evaluation.
steps.inputs: Use case cards framework and examples

steps.description: Analyze feedback to validate the framework's effectiveness.

procedures.procedureDescription: A validation process involving experts to assess the adequacy, completeness, and usability of the use case cards.

validationAndVerification.validationProcedure: The use case cards were validated through a user study involving 11 experts who evaluated the framework for adequacy, completeness, and usability.
validationAndVerification.validationResults: The validation process confirmed the effectiveness of the use case cards in framing and contextualizing AI use cases, as well as in assessing risk levels and adapting requirements.

reproducibilityAndSharing.dataAvailabilityStatement: The use case card template and all implemented examples are publicly available at the GitLab repository.
